bibl.title: The Roman Empire: Economy and Legal Practice - Parallels to the European Union? Plurality and Diversity or Uniformity of Roman Law?
bibl.note: Erweiterte Fassung des Vortrages gehalten am 23.2.2005 vor der Juristischen Fakultät der Universität Athen. - I. Introduction. - II. Some Characteristic Aspects of Citizenship and Law System in the European Union. - III. The Roman Empire of the 1st to 3rd Century AD: Economy and Life. - IV. Legal Regulations in Commerce and Economic Life. - V. The Roman Empire: Diversity of Structure and Plurality of Law Systems. - VI. Citizenship and Plurality of Law Systems. - VII. The Constitutio Antoniniana of 212 AD and the Continuity of Legal Pluralism. - VIII. The Roman Emperor: The Dominating Source of Law and Legal Decision. - IX. Conclusion. - Pp. 167-192: Selected Bibliography.
